00017 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00018 
00019   By Marco Ladino - mladinox.. jan/2016
00020 
00021 
00022   MinGW 3.45 thru 4.5 versions, don't have the socket functions:
00023 
00024   --> inet_ntop(..)
00025   --> inet_pton(..)
00026 
00027   But with this adapted code using the original functions from FreeBSD,
00028   one can to use it in the C/C++ Applications, without problem..!
00029 
00030   This implementation, include tests for IPV4 and IPV6 addresses,
00031   and is full C/C++ compatible..
00032 
00033   --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/

00054 //mladinox:: #include <sys/cdefs.h>
00055 //mladinox:: __FBSDID("$FreeBSD: stable/9/sys/libkern/strlcpy.c 243811 2012-12-03 18:08:44Z delphij $");
00056 //mladinox:: #include <sys/types.h>
00057 //mladinox:: #include <sys/libkern.h>
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * Copy src to string dst of size siz.  At most siz-1 characters
00061  * will be copied.  Always NUL terminates (unless siz == 0).
00062  * Returns strlen(src); if retval >= siz, truncation occurred.
00063  */
00064 size_t strlcpy(char *dst, const char *src, size_t siz)
00065 {
00066     char *d = dst;
00067     const char *s = src;
00068     size_t n = siz;
00069 
00070     /* Copy as many bytes as will fit */
00071     if (n != 0) {
00072         while (--n != 0) {
00073             if ((*d++ = *s++) == '\0')
00074                 break;
00075         }
00076     }
00077 
00078     /* Not enough room in dst, add NUL and traverse rest of src */
00079     if (n == 0) {
00080         if (siz != 0)
00081             *d = '\0';                          /* NUL-terminate dst */
00082         while (*s++)
00083             ;
00084     }
00085 
00086     return(s - src - 1);        /* count does not include NUL */
00087 }

00111 //mladinox:: #include <sys/cdefs.h>

00118 /*%
00119  * WARNING: Don't even consider trying to compile this on a system where
00120  * sizeof(int) < 4.  sizeof(int) > 4 is fine; all the world's not a VAX.
00121  */
00122 
00123 static char     *inet_ntop4(const unsigned char *src, char *dst, socklen_t size);
00124 static char     *inet_ntop6(const unsigned char *src, char *dst, socklen_t size);
00125 
00126 /* char *
00127  * inet_ntop(af, src, dst, size)
00128  *              convert a network format address to presentation format.
00129  * return:
00130  *              pointer to presentation format address (`dst'), or NULL (see errno).
00131  * author:
00132  *              Paul Vixie, 1996.
00133  */
00134 char *inet_ntop(int af, const void *src, char *dst, socklen_t size)
00135 {
00136     switch (af) {
00137         case AF_INET:
00138             return (inet_ntop4((const unsigned char*)src, dst, size));
00139         case AF_INET6:
00140             return (inet_ntop6((const unsigned char*)src, dst, size));
00141         default:
00142             return (NULL);
00143     }
00144     /* NOTREACHED */
00145 }
00146 
00147 /* const char *
00148  * inet_ntop4(src, dst, size)
00149  *              format an IPv4 address
00150  * return:
00151  *              `dst' (as a const)
00152  * notes:
00153  *              (1) uses no statics
00154  *              (2) takes a u_char* not an in_addr as input
00155  * author:
00156  *              Paul Vixie, 1996.
00157  */
00158 static char *inet_ntop4(const unsigned char *src, char *dst, socklen_t size)
00159 {
00160     static const char fmt[] = "%u.%u.%u.%u";
00161     char tmp[sizeof "255.255.255.255"];
00162     int l;
00163 
00164     l = snprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), fmt, src[0], src[1], src[2], src[3]);
00165     if (l <= 0 || (socklen_t) l >= size) {
00166         return (NULL);
00167     }
00168     strlcpy(dst, tmp, size);
00169     return (dst);
00170 }
00171 
00172 /* const char *
00173  * inet_ntop6(src, dst, size)
00174  *              convert IPv6 binary address into presentation (printable) format
00175  * author:
00176  *              Paul Vixie, 1996.
00177  */
00178 static char *inet_ntop6(const unsigned char *src, char *dst, socklen_t size)
00179 {
00180     /*
00181      * Note that int32_t and int16_t need only be "at least" large enough
00182      * to contain a value of the specified size.  On some systems, like
00183      * Crays, there is no such thing as an integer variable with 16 bits.
00184      * Keep this in mind if you think this function should have been coded
00185      * to use pointer overlays.  All the world's not a VAX.
00186      */
00187     char tmp[sizeof "ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:255.255.255.255"], *tp;
00188     struct { int base, len; } best, cur;
00189 #define NS_IN6ADDRSZ            16
00190 #define NS_INT16SZ              2
00191     u_int words[NS_IN6ADDRSZ / NS_INT16SZ];
00192     int i;
00193 
00194     /*
00195      * Preprocess:
00196      *          Copy the input (bytewise) array into a wordwise array.
00197      *          Find the longest run of 0x00's in src[] for :: shorthanding.
00198      */
00199     memset(words, '\0', sizeof words);
00200     for (i = 0; i < NS_IN6ADDRSZ; i++)
00201         words[i / 2] |= (src[i] << ((1 - (i % 2)) << 3));
00202     best.base = -1;
00203     best.len = 0;
00204     cur.base = -1;
00205     cur.len = 0;
00206     for (i = 0; i < (NS_IN6ADDRSZ / NS_INT16SZ); i++) {
00207         if (words[i] == 0) {
00208             if (cur.base == -1)
00209                 cur.base = i, cur.len = 1;
00210             else
00211                 cur.len++;
00212         } else {
00213             if (cur.base != -1) {
00214                 if (best.base == -1 || cur.len > best.len)
00215                     best = cur;
00216                 cur.base = -1;
00217             }
00218         }
00219     }
00220     if (cur.base != -1) {
00221         if (best.base == -1 || cur.len > best.len)
00222             best = cur;
00223     }
00224     if (best.base != -1 && best.len < 2)
00225         best.base = -1;
00226 
00227     /*
00228      * Format the result.
00229      */
00230     tp = tmp;
00231     for (i = 0; i < (NS_IN6ADDRSZ / NS_INT16SZ); i++) {
00232         /* Are we inside the best run of 0x00's? */
00233         if (best.base != -1 && i >= best.base &&
00234                 i < (best.base + best.len)) {
00235             if (i == best.base)
00236                 *tp++ = ':';
00237             continue;
00238         }
00239         /* Are we following an initial run of 0x00s or any real hex? */
00240         if (i != 0)
00241             *tp++ = ':';
00242         /* Is this address an encapsulated IPv4? */
00243         if (i == 6 && best.base == 0 && (best.len == 6 ||
00244                     (best.len == 7 && words[7] != 0x0001) ||
00245                     (best.len == 5 && words[5] == 0xffff))) {
00246             if (!inet_ntop4(src+12, tp, sizeof tmp - (tp - tmp)))
00247                 return (NULL);
00248             tp += strlen(tp);
00249             break;
00250         }
00251         tp += sprintf(tp, "%x", words[i]);
00252     }
00253     /* Was it a trailing run of 0x00's? */
00254     if (best.base != -1 && (best.base + best.len) == 
00255             (NS_IN6ADDRSZ / NS_INT16SZ))
00256         *tp++ = ':';
00257     *tp++ = '\0';
00258 
00259     /*
00260      * Check for overflow, copy, and we're done.
00261      */
00262     if ((socklen_t)(tp - tmp) > size) {
00263         return (NULL);
00264     }
00265     strcpy(dst, tmp);
00266     return (dst);
00267 }

00288 //mladinox:: #if defined(LIBC_SCCS) && !defined(lint)
00289 //mladinox:: static const char rcsid[] = "$Id: inet_pton.c,v 1.3.18.2 2005/07/28 07:38:07 marka Exp $";
00290 //mladinox:: #endif /* LIBC_SCCS and not lint */
00291 //mladinox:: #include <sys/cdefs.h>
00292 //mladinox:: __FBSDID("$FreeBSD: stable/9/sys/libkern/inet_pton.c 213103 2010-09-24 15:01:45Z attilio $");
00293 //mladinox:: #include <sys/param.h>
00294 //mladinox:: #include <sys/socket.h>
00295 //mladinox:: #include <sys/systm.h>
00296 //mladinox:: #include <netinet/in.h>
00297 //mladinox:: #if __FreeBSD_version < 700000
00298 //mladinox:: #define strchr index

00301 /*%
00302  * WARNING: Don't even consider trying to compile this on a system where
00303  * sizeof(int) < 4.  sizeof(int) > 4 is fine; all the world's not a VAX.
00304  */
00305 
00306 static int      inet_pton4(const char *src, u_char *dst);
00307 static int      inet_pton6(const char *src, u_char *dst);
00308 
00309 /* int
00310  * inet_pton(af, src, dst)
00311  *              convert from presentation format (which usually means ASCII printable)
00312  *              to network format (which is usually some kind of binary format).
00313  * return:
00314  *              1 if the address was valid for the specified address family
00315  *              0 if the address wasn't valid (`dst' is untouched in this case)
00316  *              -1 if some other error occurred (`dst' is untouched in this case, too)
00317  * author:
00318  *              Paul Vixie, 1996.
00319  */
00320 int inet_pton(int af, const char *src, void *dst)
00321 {
00322     switch (af) {
00323         case AF_INET:
00324             return (inet_pton4(src, (unsigned char *)dst));
00325         case AF_INET6:
00326             return (inet_pton6(src, (unsigned char *)dst));
00327         default:
00328             return (-1);
00329     }
00330     /* NOTREACHED */
00331 }
00332 
00333 /* int
00334  * inet_pton4(src, dst)
00335  *              like inet_aton() but without all the hexadecimal and shorthand.
00336  * return:
00337  *              1 if `src' is a valid dotted quad, else 0.
00338  * notice:
00339  *              does not touch `dst' unless it's returning 1.
00340  * author:
00341  *              Paul Vixie, 1996.
00342  */
00343 static int inet_pton4(const char *src, u_char *dst)
00344 {
00345     static const char digits[] = "0123456789";
00346     int saw_digit, octets, ch;
00347 #define NS_INADDRSZ             4
00348     u_char tmp[NS_INADDRSZ], *tp;
00349 
00350     saw_digit = 0;
00351     octets = 0;
00352     *(tp = tmp) = 0;
00353     while ((ch = *src++) != '\0') {
00354         const char *pch;
00355 
00356         if ((pch = strchr(digits, ch)) != NULL) {
00357             u_int uiNew = *tp * 10 + (pch - digits);
00358 
00359             if (saw_digit && *tp == 0)
00360                 return (0);
00361             if (uiNew > 255)
00362                 return (0);
00363             *tp = uiNew;
00364             if (!saw_digit) {
00365                 if (++octets > 4)
00366                     return (0);
00367                 saw_digit = 1;
00368             }
00369         } else if (ch == '.' && saw_digit) {
00370             if (octets == 4)
00371                 return (0);
00372             *++tp = 0;
00373             saw_digit = 0;
00374         } else
00375             return (0);
00376     }
00377     if (octets < 4)
00378         return (0);
00379     memcpy(dst, tmp, NS_INADDRSZ);
00380     return (1);
00381 }
00382 
00383 /* int
00384  * inet_pton6(src, dst)
00385  *              convert presentation level address to network order binary form.
00386  * return:
00387  *              1 if `src' is a valid [RFC1884 2.2] address, else 0.
00388  * notice:
00389  *              (1) does not touch `dst' unless it's returning 1.
00390  *              (2) :: in a full address is silently ignored.
00391  * credit:
00392  *              inspired by Mark Andrews.
00393  * author:
00394  *              Paul Vixie, 1996.
00395  */
00396 static int inet_pton6(const char *src, u_char *dst)
00397 {
00398     static const char xdigits_l[] = "0123456789abcdef",
00399                  xdigits_u[] = "0123456789ABCDEF";
00400 #define NS_IN6ADDRSZ            16
00401 #define NS_INT16SZ              2
00402     u_char tmp[NS_IN6ADDRSZ], *tp, *endp, *colonp;
00403     const char *xdigits, *curtok;
00404     int ch, seen_xdigits;
00405     u_int val;
00406 
00407     memset((tp = tmp), '\0', NS_IN6ADDRSZ);
00408     endp = tp + NS_IN6ADDRSZ;
00409     colonp = NULL;
00410     /* Leading :: requires some special handling. */
00411     if (*src == ':')
00412         if (*++src != ':')
00413             return (0);
00414     curtok = src;
00415     seen_xdigits = 0;
00416     val = 0;
00417     while ((ch = *src++) != '\0') {
00418         const char *pch;
00419 
00420         if ((pch = strchr((xdigits = xdigits_l), ch)) == NULL)
00421             pch = strchr((xdigits = xdigits_u), ch);
00422         if (pch != NULL) {
00423             val <<= 4;
00424             val |= (pch - xdigits);
00425             if (++seen_xdigits > 4)
00426                 return (0);
00427             continue;
00428         }
00429         if (ch == ':') {
00430             curtok = src;
00431             if (!seen_xdigits) {
00432                 if (colonp)
00433                     return (0);
00434                 colonp = tp;
00435                 continue;
00436             } else if (*src == '\0') {
00437                 return (0);
00438             }
00439             if (tp + NS_INT16SZ > endp)
00440                 return (0);
00441             *tp++ = (u_char) (val >> 8) & 0xff;
00442             *tp++ = (u_char) val & 0xff;
00443             seen_xdigits = 0;
00444             val = 0;
00445             continue;
00446         }
00447         if (ch == '.' && ((tp + NS_INADDRSZ) <= endp) &&
00448                 inet_pton4(curtok, tp) > 0) {
00449             tp += NS_INADDRSZ;
00450             seen_xdigits = 0;
00451             break;              /*%< '\\0' was seen by inet_pton4(). */
00452         }
00453         return (0);
00454     }
00455     if (seen_xdigits) {
00456         if (tp + NS_INT16SZ > endp)
00457             return (0);
00458         *tp++ = (u_char) (val >> 8) & 0xff;
00459         *tp++ = (u_char) val & 0xff;
00460     }
00461     if (colonp != NULL) {
00462         /*
00463          * Since some memmove()'s erroneously fail to handle
00464          * overlapping regions, we'll do the shift by hand.
00465          */
00466         const int n = tp - colonp;
00467         int i;
00468 
00469         if (tp == endp)
00470             return (0);
00471         for (i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
00472             endp[- i] = colonp[n - i];
00473             colonp[n - i] = 0;
00474         }
00475         tp = endp;
00476     }
00477     if (tp != endp)
00478         return (0);
00479     memcpy(dst, tmp, NS_IN6ADDRSZ);
00480     return (1);
00481 }

00483 #endif /* ifdef WINDOWS */

00487 /*!\fn NETWORK *netw_new( int send_list_limit , int recv_list_limit )
00488  *\brief Return an empty allocated network ready to be netw_closed
00489  *\param send_list_limit Thread engine number of tosend message limit
00490  *\param recv_list_limit Thread engine number of received message limit
00491  *\return NULL or a new empty network
00492  */
00493 NETWORK *netw_new( int send_list_limit , int recv_list_limit )
00494 {
00495     NETWORK *netw = NULL ;
00496 
00497     Malloc( netw, NETWORK , 1 );
00498     __n_assert( netw, return NULL );
00499 
00500     /* netw itself */
00501     netw -> nb_pending = -1 ;
00502     netw -> mode = -1 ;
00503     netw -> state = NETW_EXITED ;
00504     netw -> threaded_engine_status = NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED ;
00505 
00506     /* netw -> link */
00507     netw -> link . sock = -1 ;
00508     netw -> link . port =
00509         netw -> link . ip = NULL ;
00510     memset( &netw -> link . hints , 0 , sizeof( struct addrinfo ) );
00511     memset( &netw -> link . raddr , 0 , sizeof( struct sockaddr_storage ) );
00512 
00513     /*initiliaze mutexs*/
00514     if ( pthread_mutex_init( &netw -> sendbolt , NULL ) != 0 )
00515     {
00516         n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error initializing netw -> sendbolt" ); 
00517         Free( netw );
00518         return NULL ;
00519     }
00520     /*initiliaze mutexs*/
00521     if ( pthread_mutex_init( &netw -> recvbolt , NULL ) != 0 )
00522     {
00523         n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error initializing netw -> recvbolt" ); 
00524         pthread_mutex_destroy( &netw -> sendbolt );
00525         Free( netw );
00526         return NULL ;
00527     }
00528     /*initiliaze mutexs*/
00529     if ( pthread_mutex_init( &netw -> eventbolt , NULL ) != 0 )
00530     {
00531         n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error initializing netw -> eventbolt" ); 
00532         pthread_mutex_destroy( &netw -> sendbolt );
00533         pthread_mutex_destroy( &netw -> recvbolt );
00534         Free( netw );
00535         return NULL ;
00536     }
00537     /*initialize queues */
00538     netw -> recv_buf = new_generic_list( recv_list_limit );
00539     if( ! netw -> recv_buf )
00540     {
00541         n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error when creating receive list with %d item limit" , recv_list_limit );
00542         netw_close( &netw );
00543         return NULL ;
00544     }
00545     netw -> send_buf = new_generic_list( send_list_limit );
00546     if( !netw -> send_buf )
00547     {
00548         n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error when creating send list with %d item limit" , send_list_limit );
00549         netw_close( &netw );
00550         return NULL ;
00551     }
00552     netw -> addr_infos_loaded = 0 ;
00553     netw -> send_queue_wait = 25000 ;
00554     netw -> send_queue_consecutive_wait = 1000 ;
00555     netw -> pause_wait = 200000 ;
00556     netw -> so_sndbuf = 0 ;
00557     netw -> so_rcvbuf = 0 ;
00558     netw -> tcpnodelay = 0 ;
00559 
00560     return netw ;
00561 
00562 } /* netw_new() */
00563 
00564 
00565 /*!\fn int netw_set_timers( NETWORK *netw , int send_queue_wait , int send_queue_consecutive_wait , int pause_wait )
00566  * \brief set the timers used when activating threaded network
00567  * \param netw Network to tune
00568  * \param send_queue_wait Time between each send_queue check if last call wasn't sending anything
00569  * \param send_queue_consecutive_wait Time between each send_queue check if last call was a sending one
00570  * \param pause_wait Time between each state check when network is paused
00571  * \return TRUE or FALSE
00572  */
00573 int netw_set_timers( NETWORK *netw , int send_queue_wait , int send_queue_consecutive_wait , int pause_wait )
00574 {
00575     __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
00576     pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> eventbolt );
00577     netw -> send_queue_wait = send_queue_wait ;
00578     netw -> send_queue_consecutive_wait = send_queue_consecutive_wait ;
00579     netw -> pause_wait = pause_wait ;
00580     pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> eventbolt );
00581     return TRUE ;
00582 }

00586 /*!\fn void *get_in_addr(struct sockaddr *sa)
00587  *\brief get sockaddr, IPv4 or IPv6 
00588  *\param sa socket_address
00589  */
00590 void *get_in_addr(struct sockaddr *sa)
00591 {
00592                 if (sa->sa_family == AF_INET) 
00593                 {
00594         return &(((struct sockaddr_in*)sa)->sin_addr);
00595     }
00596     return &(((struct sockaddr_in6*)sa)->sin6_addr);
00597 }
00598 
00599 
00600 
00601 /*!\fn int handle_wsa( int mode , int v1 , int v2 )
00602  *\brief Do not directly use, internal api.
00603  *\param mode 1 for opening 0 for close 2 for status
00604  *\param v1 First digit of version requested
00605  *\param v2 Second digit of version requested
00606  *\return TRUE on success FALSE on error
00607  */
00608 int handle_wsa( int mode , int v1 , int v2 )
00609 {
00610     int compiler_warning_suppressor = 0 ;
00611 #if !defined( LINUX ) && !defined( SOLARIS ) && !defined( AIX )
00612     static WSADATA WSAdata; /*WSA world*/
00613     static int WSA_IS_INITIALIZED = 0; /*status checking*/
00614 
00615     switch ( mode )
00616     {
00617                                 default:
00618         /*returning WSA status*/
00619         case 2 :
00620             return WSA_IS_INITIALIZED;
00621             break;
00622             /*loading WSA dll*/
00623         case 1 :
00624             if ( WSA_IS_INITIALIZED == 1 )
00625                 return TRUE; /*already loaded*/
00626             if ( ( WSAStartup( MAKEWORD( v1 , v2 ), &WSAdata ) ) != 0 )
00627             {
00628                 WSA_IS_INITIALIZED = 0;
00629                 return FALSE;
00630             }
00631             else
00632             {
00633                 WSA_IS_INITIALIZED = 1 ;
00634                 return TRUE;
00635             }
00636             break;
00637             /*unloading (closing) WSA */
00638         case 0 :
00639             if ( WSA_IS_INITIALIZED == 0 )
00640                 return TRUE; /*already CLEANED or not loaded */
00641             if ( WSACleanup() == 0 )
00642             {
00643                 WSA_IS_INITIALIZED = 0;
00644                 return TRUE;
00645             }
00646             break;
00647     } /*switch(...)*/
00648 #endif /*#ifndef LINUX SOLARIS AIX */
00649     compiler_warning_suppressor = mode + v1 + v2 ;
00650     compiler_warning_suppressor = TRUE ;
00651     return compiler_warning_suppressor ;
00652 } /*handle_wsa(...)*/
00653 
00654 
00655 
00656 /*!\fn int netw_setsockopt( SOCKET sock , int disable_naggle , int sock_send_buf , int sock_recv_buf )
00657  *\brief Modify common socket options. Enable SO_REUSEADDR.  
00658  *\param sock The socket to configure
00659  *\param disable_naggle Set to positive to enable. Set to negative to force disable, 0 untouched
00660  *\param sock_send_buf If >0, then try to set the socket send buffer size in octet
00661  *\param sock_recv_buf If >0, then try to set the socket recv buffer size in octet
00662  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00663  */
00664 int netw_setsockopt( SOCKET sock , int disable_naggle , int sock_send_buf , int sock_recv_buf )
00665 {
00666     /* disable naggle algorithm */
00667     if( disable_naggle > 0 )
00668     {
00669         if ( setsockopt( sock , IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, ( const char * ) &disable_naggle, sizeof( disable_naggle ) ) == -1 )
00670         {
00671             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from setsockopt(TCP_NODELAY). errno: %s" , strerror( errno ) );
00672             return FALSE ;
00673         }
00674     }
00675     if( disable_naggle < 0 )
00676     {
00677         if ( setsockopt( sock , IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, ( const char * ) &disable_naggle, sizeof( disable_naggle ) ) == -1 )
00678         {
00679             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from setsockopt(TCP_NODELAY). errno: %s" , strerror( errno ) );
00680             return FALSE ;
00681         }
00682     }
00683 
00684     /* socket sending buffer size */
00685     if( sock_send_buf > 0 )
00686     {
00687         if ( setsockopt ( sock , SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, ( const char * ) &sock_send_buf, sizeof( sock_send_buf ) ) == -1 )
00688         {
00689             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from setsockopt(SO_SNDBUF). errno: %s" , strerror( errno ) );
00690             return FALSE ;
00691         }
00692     }
00693 
00694     /* socket receiving buffer */
00695     if( sock_recv_buf > 0 )
00696     {
00697         if ( setsockopt ( sock , SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, ( const char * ) &sock_recv_buf, sizeof( sock_recv_buf ) ) == -1 )
00698         {
00699             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from setsockopt(SO_RCVBUF). errno: %s" , strerror( errno ) );
00700             return FALSE ;
00701         }
00702     }
00703 
00704     int tmp = 1 ;
00705     /* lose the pesky "Address already in use" error message*/
00706 #ifndef WINDOWS
00707     if ( setsockopt( sock , SOL_SOCKET, (SO_REUSEPORT | SO_REUSEADDR) , (char *)&tmp , sizeof( tmp ) ) == -1 )
00708     {
00709 #else
00710         if ( setsockopt( sock , SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR , (char *)&tmp , sizeof( tmp ) ) == -1 )
00711         {
00712 #endif
00713             int error=errno ;
00714             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from setsockopt(SO_REUSEADDR). errno: %s" , strerror( error ) );
00715             return FALSE ;
00716         }
00717 
00718         /* Do not close until all data is sent/reiceived, for 3 seconds  */
00719         struct linger linger = { 0 , 0 };
00720         linger.l_onoff = 1 ;
00721         linger.l_linger = 3 ;
00722         if ( setsockopt( sock , SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER , (const char *)&linger , sizeof( linger ) ) == -1 )
00723         {
00724             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from setsockopt(SO_LINGER). errno: %s" , strerror( errno ) );
00725             return FALSE ;
00726         } 
00727 
00728         return TRUE ;
00729     } /* netw_setsockopt( ... ) */
00730 
00731 
00732 
00733     /*!\fn int netw_connect_ex(NETWORK **netw , char *host , char *port, int disable_naggle , int sock_send_buf , int sock_recv_buf , int send_list_limit , int recv_list_limit , int ip_version )
00734      *\brief Use this to connect a NETWORK to any listening one
00735      *\param netw a NETWORK *object
00736      *\param host Host or IP to connect to
00737      *\param port Port to use to connect
00738      *\param disable_naggle Disable Naggle Algorithm. Set to 1 do activate, 0 or negative to leave defaults
00739      *\param sock_send_buf NETW_SOCKET_SEND_BUF socket parameter , 0 or negative to leave defaults
00740      *\param sock_recv_buf NETW_SOCKET_RECV_BUF socket parameter , 0 or negative to leave defaults
00741      *\param send_list_limit Internal sending list maximum number of item. 0 or negative for unrestricted
00742      *\param recv_list_limit Internal receiving list maximum number of item. 0 or negative for unrestricted
00743                  *\param ip_version NETWORK_IPALL for both ipv4 and ipv6 , NETWORK_IPV4 or NETWORK_IPV6
00744      *\return TRUE or FALSE
00745      */
00746     int netw_connect_ex( NETWORK **netw , char *host , char *port, int disable_naggle , int sock_send_buf , int sock_recv_buf , int send_list_limit , int recv_list_limit , int ip_version  )
00747     {
00748         int error = 0 ,net_status = 0;
00749 
00750         /*do not work over an already used netw*/
00751         if( (*netw) )
00752         {
00753             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to allocate (*netw), already existing. You must use empty NETWORK *structs." );
00754             return FALSE ;
00755         }
00756 
00757         /*creating array*/
00758         (*netw) = netw_new( send_list_limit , recv_list_limit );
00759         __n_assert( (*netw) , return FALSE );
00760 
00761         /*checking WSA when under windows*/
00762         if ( handle_wsa( 1 , 2 , 2 ) == FALSE )
00763         {
00764             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to load WSA dll's" );
00765             Free( (*netw) );
00766             return FALSE ;
00767         }
00768   /*creating array*/
00769                                 if( ip_version == NETWORK_IPV4 )
00770                                 {
00771                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_family   = AF_INET ;     /* Allow IPv4 */
00772                                 }
00773                                 else if( ip_version == NETWORK_IPV4 )
00774                                 {
00775                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_family   = AF_INET6 ;     /* Allow IPv6 */
00776                                 }
00777                                 else
00778                                 {
00779                                                 /* NETWORK_ALL or unknown value */
00780                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_family   = AF_UNSPEC;     /* Allow IPv4 or IPv6 */
00781                                 }
00782         
00783                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;   
00784                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;   
00785         (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_flags    = AI_PASSIVE;    
00786                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_canonname = NULL;
00787                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_next = NULL;
00788                                 
00789         /* Note: on some system, i.e Solaris, it WILL show leak in getaddrinfo.
00790          * Testing it inside a 1,100 loop showed not effect on the amount of leaked
00791          * memory */
00792         error = getaddrinfo( host , port , &(*netw) -> link . hints , &(*netw) -> link . rhost );
00793         if( error != 0 )
00794         {
00795             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error when resolving %s:%s getaddrinfo: %s", host , port , gai_strerror( error ) );
00796             netw_close( &(*netw) );
00797             return FALSE ;
00798         }
00799         (*netw) -> addr_infos_loaded = 1 ;
00800                 Malloc( (*netw) -> link . ip , char , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN + 2 );
00801                                 __n_assert( (*netw) -> link . ip , netw_close( &(*netw ) ); return FALSE );
00802 
00803         /* getaddrinfo() returns a list of address structures. Try each address until we successfully connect. If socket or connect fails, we close the socket and try the next address. */
00804         struct addrinfo *rp = NULL ;
00805         for( rp = (*netw) -> link . rhost ; rp != NULL ; rp = rp -> ai_next )
00806         {
00807             struct sockaddr_in *addr = NULL ;
00808             addr = (struct sockaddr_in *)rp->ai_addr;
00809             int sock = socket( rp -> ai_family , rp -> ai_socktype , rp->ai_protocol );
00810             error = errno ;
00811             if( sock == -1 )
00812             {  
00813                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error while trying to make a socket: %s"  ,strerror( error ) );
00814                 continue ;
00815             }
00816             if( netw_setsockopt( sock , disable_naggle , sock_send_buf , sock_recv_buf ) != TRUE )
00817             {
00818                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Some socket options could not be set on %d" , (*netw) -> link . sock );   
00819             }
00820             net_status = connect( sock , rp -> ai_addr , rp -> ai_addrlen ); 
00821                                                   /*storing connected port and ip adress*/
00822                                 if( !inet_ntop( rp->ai_family , get_in_addr( (struct sockaddr *)rp -> ai_addr ) , (*netw) -> link . ip , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN ) )
00823                                 {
00824                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "inet_ntop: %p , %s" , rp , strerror( errno ) );  
00825                         }
00826             error = errno ;
00827             if( net_status == -1 )
00828             {
00829                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error while trying to connect to %s : %s , resolved addr %s , %s" , host , port ,  (*netw) -> link . ip , strerror( error ) );
00830                 closesocket( sock );
00831                 continue ;
00832             }
00833             else
00834             {
00835                 (*netw) -> link . sock = sock ;
00836                 break;                  /* Success */
00837             }
00838         }
00839         if( rp == NULL )
00840         {
00841             /* No address succeeded */
00842             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Couldn't connect to %s:%s", host , port );
00843             netw_close( &(*netw) );
00844             return FALSE ;
00845         }
00846 
00847         /*storing connected port and ip adress*/
00848         Malloc( (*netw) -> link . ip , char , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN + 2 );
00849         __n_assert( (*netw) -> link . ip , netw_close( &(*netw ) ); return FALSE );
00850         if( !inet_ntop( rp->ai_family , get_in_addr( (struct sockaddr *)rp -> ai_addr ) , (*netw) -> link . ip , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN ) )
00851         {
00852             n_log( LOG_ERR , "inet_ntop: %p , %s" , rp , strerror( errno ) );  
00853         }
00854 
00855 
00856         (*netw)->link . port = strdup( port );
00857         __n_assert( (*netw) -> link . port , netw_close( &(*netw ) ); return FALSE );
00858 
00859         n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Connected to %s:%s" , (*netw) -> link . ip , (*netw) -> link . port );
00860 
00861         netw_set( (*netw) , NETW_CLIENT|NETW_RUN|NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED );
00862 
00863         return TRUE ;
00864     } /* netw_connect_ex(...)*/
00865 
00866 
00867 
00868     /*!\fn int netw_connect( NETWORK **netw , char *host , char *port , int ip_version )
00869      *\brief Use this to connect a NETWORK to any listening one, with following defaults: disable_naggle = 0 , untouched sockbufsendsize and sockbufrecvsize and unrestricted sned/recv lists
00870      *\param netw a NETWORK *object
00871      *\param host Host or IP to connect to
00872      *\param port Port to use to connect
00873                  *\param ip_version NETWORK_IPALL for both ipv4 and ipv6 , NETWORK_IPV4 or NETWORK_IPV6
00874      *\return TRUE or FALSE
00875      */
00876     int netw_connect( NETWORK **netw , char *host , char *port , int ip_version )
00877     {
00878         n_log( LOG_INFO , "Trying to connect to %s : %s" , _str( host ) , _str( port ) );
00879         return netw_connect_ex( &(*netw) , host , port , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , ip_version );
00880     } /* netw_connect() */
00881 
00882 
00883 
00884     /*!\fn int netw_get_state( NETWORK *netw , int *state , int *thr_engine_status )
00885      *\brief Get the state of a network
00886      *\param netw The NETWORK *connection to query
00887      *\param state pointer to network status storage , NETW_PAUSE , NETW_RUN , NETW_EXIT_ASKED , NETW_EXITED
00888      *\param thr_engine_status pointer to network thread engine status storage ,NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED , NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED
00889      *\return TRUE or FALSE
00890      */
00891     int netw_get_state( NETWORK *netw , int *state , int *thr_engine_status )
00892     {
00893         if( netw )
00894         {
00895             pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> sendbolt );
00896             if( state )
00897                 (*state) = netw -> state ;
00898             if( thr_engine_status )
00899                 (*thr_engine_status) = netw -> threaded_engine_status ;
00900             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> sendbolt );
00901             return TRUE ;
00902         }
00903         else
00904         {
00905             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't get status of a NULL network" );
00906         }
00907         return FALSE ;
00908     } /*netw_get_state() */
00909 
00910 
00911 
00912     /*!\fn int netw_set( NETWORK *netw , int flag )
00913      *\brief Restart or reset the specified network ability
00914      *\param netw The NETWORK *connection to modify
00915      *\param flag NETW_EMPTY_SENDBUF, NETW_EMPTY_RECVBUF, NETW_PAUSE , NETW_RUN , NETW_EXIT_ASKED , NETW_EXITED
00916      *\return TRUE or FALSE
00917      */
00918     int netw_set( NETWORK *netw , int flag )
00919     {
00920         if( flag & NETW_EMPTY_SENDBUF )
00921         {
00922             pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> sendbolt );
00923             if( netw -> send_buf )
00924                 list_empty( netw -> send_buf );
00925             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> sendbolt );
00926         };
00927         if( flag & NETW_EMPTY_RECVBUF )
00928         {
00929             pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> recvbolt );
00930             if( netw -> recv_buf )
00931                 list_empty( netw -> recv_buf );
00932             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> recvbolt );
00933         }
00934         if( flag & NETW_DESTROY_SENDBUF )
00935         {
00936             pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> sendbolt );
00937             if( netw -> send_buf )
00938                 list_destroy( &netw -> send_buf );
00939             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> sendbolt );
00940         };
00941         if( flag & NETW_DESTROY_RECVBUF )
00942         {
00943             pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> recvbolt );
00944             if( netw -> recv_buf )
00945                 list_destroy( &netw -> recv_buf );
00946             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> recvbolt );
00947         }
00948         pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> eventbolt );
00949         if( flag & NETW_CLIENT )
00950         {
00951             netw -> mode = NETW_CLIENT ;
00952         }  
00953         if( flag & NETW_SERVER )
00954         {
00955             netw -> mode = NETW_SERVER ;
00956         }
00957         if( flag & NETW_RUN )
00958         {
00959             netw -> state = NETW_RUN ;
00960         }  
00961         if( flag & NETW_PAUSE )
00962         {
00963             netw -> state = NETW_PAUSE ;
00964         }
00965         if( flag & NETW_EXITED )
00966         {
00967             netw -> state = NETW_EXITED ;
00968         }
00969         if( flag & NETW_ERROR )
00970         {
00971             netw -> state = NETW_ERROR ;
00972         }
00973         if( flag & NETW_EXIT_ASKED )
00974         {
00975             netw -> state = NETW_EXIT_ASKED ;
00976         } 
00977         if( flag & NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED )
00978         {
00979             netw -> threaded_engine_status = NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED ;
00980         }
00981         if( flag & NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED )
00982         {
00983             netw -> threaded_engine_status = NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED ;
00984         }
00985         pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> eventbolt );
00986         return TRUE;
00987     } /* netw_set(...) */
00988 
00989 
00990 
00991     /*!\fn netw_close( NETWORK **netw )
00992      *\brief Closing a specified Network, destroy queues, free the structure
00993      *\param netw A NETWORK *network to close
00994      *\return TRUE on success , FALSE on failure
00995      */
00996     int netw_close( NETWORK **netw )
00997     {
00998         int state = 0 , thr_engine_status = 0 ;
00999         __n_assert( (*netw) , return FALSE );
01000 
01001         netw_get_state( (*netw) , &state , &thr_engine_status );
01002         if( thr_engine_status == NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED )
01003         {
01004             netw_stop_thr_engine( (*netw ) ); 
01005         }
01006         /*closing connection*/
01007         /* Now with end of send fix */
01008         if( (*netw) -> link . sock != INVALID_SOCKET )
01009         {
01010             shutdown( (*netw) -> link . sock , SHUT_WR );
01011             int res = 0 ;
01012             char buffer[ 4096 ] = "" ;
01013             for( ;; )
01014             {
01015                 res = read( (*netw) -> link . sock , buffer , 4096 );
01016                 if( !res )
01017                     break;
01018                 if( res < 0 )
01019                 {
01020                     /*n_log( LOG_ERR , "read returned an error when closing socket %d: %s" , (*netw) -> link . sock , strerror( errno ) );*/
01021                     break ;
01022                 }
01023             }
01024             closesocket( (*netw) -> link . sock );
01025                                                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "socket %d closed" , (*netw) -> link . sock );
01026         }
01027 
01028         FreeNoLog( (*netw) -> link . ip );
01029         FreeNoLog( (*netw) -> link . port );
01030 
01031         if( (*netw) -> addr_infos_loaded == 1 )
01032             freeaddrinfo( (*netw) -> link . rhost );
01033 
01034         /*list freeing*/
01035         netw_set( (*netw) , NETW_DESTROY_SENDBUF|NETW_DESTROY_RECVBUF );
01036 
01037         pthread_mutex_destroy( &(*netw) -> recvbolt );
01038         pthread_mutex_destroy( &(*netw) -> sendbolt );
01039         pthread_mutex_destroy( &(*netw) -> eventbolt );
01040 
01041         Free( (*netw) );
01042 
01043         return TRUE;
01044     } /* netw_close(...)*/
01045 
01046 
01047 
01048     /*!\fn int netw_make_listening( NETWORK **netw , char *addr , char *port , int nbpending  , int ip_version )
01049      *\brief Make a NETWORK be a Listening network
01050      *\param netw A NETWORK **network to make listening
01051                  *\param addr Adress to bind, NULL for automatic address filling
01052                  *\param port For choosing a PORT to listen to
01053                  *\param nbpending Number of pending connection when listening
01054                  *\param ip_version NETWORK_IPALL for both ipv4 and ipv6 , NETWORK_IPV4 or NETWORK_IPV6
01055      *\return TRUE on success, FALSE on error
01056      */
01057     int netw_make_listening( NETWORK **netw , char *addr , char *port , int nbpending  , int ip_version )
01058     {
01059         /*checking WSA when under windows*/
01060         if ( handle_wsa( 1 , 2 , 2 ) == FALSE )
01061         {
01062             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to load WSA dll's" );
01063             return FALSE ;
01064         }
01065 
01066         if( *netw )
01067         {
01068             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Cannot use an allocated network. Please pass a NULL network to modify" );
01069             return FALSE; 
01070         }
01071         (*netw) = netw_new( -1 , -1 ); 
01072         (*netw) -> link . port = strdup( port );
01073         /*creating array*/
01074                                 if( ip_version == NETWORK_IPV4 )
01075                                 {
01076                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_family   = AF_INET ;     /* Allow IPv4 */
01077                                 }
01078                                 else if( ip_version == NETWORK_IPV4 )
01079                                 {
01080                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_family   = AF_INET6 ;     /* Allow IPv6 */
01081                                 }
01082                                 else
01083                                 {
01084                                                 /* NETWORK_ALL or unknown value */
01085                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_family   = AF_UNSPEC;     /* Allow IPv4 or IPv6 */
01086                                 }
01087         if( !addr )
01088                                 {
01089                                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_flags    = AI_PASSIVE;    /* For wildcard IP address */
01090                                 }
01091                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;   
01092                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;   
01093                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_canonname = NULL;
01094                                 (*netw) -> link . hints . ai_next = NULL;
01095                                 
01096         int error = getaddrinfo( addr , port , &(*netw) -> link . hints , &(*netw) -> link . rhost );
01097         if( error != 0)
01098         {
01099             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error when creating listening socket on port %s", port , gai_strerror( error ) );
01100             netw_close( &(*netw) );
01101             return FALSE ;
01102         }
01103                                 
01104         (*netw) -> addr_infos_loaded = 1 ;
01105 
01106         /* getaddrinfo() returns a list of address structures.
01107            Try each address until we successfully connect(2).
01108            If socket(2) (or connect(2)) fails, we (close the socket
01109            and) try the next address. */
01110         struct addrinfo *rp = NULL ;
01111         for( rp = (*netw) -> link . rhost ; rp != NULL ; rp = rp -> ai_next )
01112         {
01113             (*netw) -> link . sock = socket( rp -> ai_family , rp -> ai_socktype , rp->ai_protocol );
01114             if( (*netw) -> link . sock == INVALID_SOCKET )
01115             {  
01116                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error while trying to make a socket: %s"  ,strerror( errno ) );
01117                 continue ;
01118             }
01119                                                 if( netw_setsockopt( (*netw) -> link . sock , 0 , 0 , 0 ) != TRUE )
01120                 {
01121                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Some socket options could not be set on %d" , (*netw) -> link . sock );   
01122                         }
01123             if( bind( (*netw) -> link . sock , rp -> ai_addr , rp -> ai_addrlen ) == 0 )
01124             {
01125                                                                 char *ip = NULL ;
01126                                                                 Malloc( ip , char , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN + 1 );
01127                                                                 if( !inet_ntop( rp -> ai_family , get_in_addr( rp-> ai_addr ) , ip , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN ) )
01128                                                                 {
01129                                                                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "inet_ntop: %p , %s" , (*netw) -> link . raddr , strerror( errno ) );  
01130                                                                 }
01131                                                                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Socket %d successfully binded to %s %s" ,  (*netw) -> link . sock , ip , port );
01132                                                                 (*netw) -> link . ip = ip ;
01133                 break;                  /* Success */
01134             }
01135             error = errno ;
01136             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error from bind() on port %s errno: %s" , port , strerror( errno ) , error );
01137             closesocket( (*netw) -> link .sock );
01138         }
01139         if( rp == NULL )
01140         {
01141             /* No address succeeded */
01142             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Couldn't get a socket for listening on port %s", port );
01143             netw_close( &(*netw) );
01144             return FALSE ;
01145         }
01146                 
01147         /* nb_pending connections*/
01148         ( *netw ) -> nb_pending = nbpending ;
01149         listen( ( *netw ) -> link . sock, ( *netw ) -> nb_pending );
01150 
01151         netw_set( (*netw) , NETW_SERVER|NETW_RUN|NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED );
01152 
01153         return TRUE;
01154     } /* netw_make_listening(...)*/
01155 
01156 
01157 
01158     /*!\fn NETWORK *netw_accept_from_ex( NETWORK *from , int disable_naggle , int sock_send_buf , int sock_recv_buf , int send_list_limit , int recv_list_limit , int non_blocking , int *retval )
01159      *\brief make a normal 'accept' . Network 'from' must be allocated with netw_make_listening.
01160      *\param from the network from where we accept
01161      *\param disable_naggle Disable Naggle Algorithm. Set to 1 do activate, 0 or negative to leave defaults
01162      *\param sock_send_buf NETW_SOCKET_SEND_BUF socket parameter , 0 or negative to leave defaults
01163      *\param sock_recv_buf NETW_SOCKET_RECV_BUF socket parameter , 0 or negative to leave defaults
01164      *\param send_list_limit Internal sending list maximum number of item. 0 or negative for unrestricted
01165      *\param recv_list_limit Internal receiving list maximum number of item. 0 or negative for unrestricted
01166      *\param non_blocking set to -1 to make it non blocking, to 0 for blocking, else it's the select timeout value in mseconds.
01167      *\param retval EAGAIN ou EWOULDBLOCK or errno
01168      *\return NULL on failure, if not a pointer to the connected network
01169      */
01170     NETWORK *netw_accept_from_ex( NETWORK *from , int disable_naggle , int sock_send_buf , int sock_recv_buf , int send_list_limit , int recv_list_limit , int non_blocking , int *retval )
01171     {
01172         int tmp = 0 ;
01173         fd_set accept_set ;
01174 
01175         FD_ZERO( &accept_set );
01176 
01177 #if defined( LINUX ) || defined( SOLARIS ) || defined( AIX )
01178         socklen_t sin_size = 0 ;
01179 #else
01180         int sin_size = 0 ;
01181 #endif
01182 
01183         NETWORK *netw = NULL ;
01184 
01185         /*checking WSA when under windows*/
01186         if( handle_wsa( 1 , 2 , 2 ) == FALSE )
01187         {
01188             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to load WSA dll's" );
01189             return NULL ;
01190         }
01191 
01192         __n_assert( from , return NULL );
01193 
01194         netw = netw_new( send_list_limit , recv_list_limit );
01195 
01196         sin_size = sizeof( netw -> link . raddr );
01197 
01198         if( non_blocking > 0 )
01199         {
01200             struct timeval select_timeout ;
01201             select_timeout . tv_sec = non_blocking ;
01202             select_timeout . tv_usec = 0;
01203 
01204             FD_SET( from -> link . sock , &accept_set );
01205 
01206             int ret = select( from -> link . sock + 1 , &accept_set , NULL , NULL , &select_timeout );
01207             if( ret == -1 )
01208             {
01209                 if( retval != NULL )
01210                     (*retval) = errno ;
01211                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error on select with %d timeout" , non_blocking );
01212                 netw_close( &netw );
01213                 return NULL;
01214             }
01215             else if( ret == 0 )
01216             {
01217                 /* that one produce waaaay too much logs under a lot of cases */
01218                 /* n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "No connection waiting on %d" , from -> link . sock ); */    
01219                 netw_close( &netw );
01220                 return NULL;
01221             }
01222             if( FD_ISSET(  from -> link . sock , &accept_set ) ) 
01223             {          
01224                 tmp = accept( from -> link . sock, (struct sockaddr * )&netw -> link . raddr , &sin_size );
01225                 int error = errno ;
01226                 if ( tmp < 0 )
01227                 {
01228                     if( retval != NULL )
01229                         (*retval) = errno ;
01230                     n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "error accepting on %d, %s" , netw -> link . sock , strerror( error ) );
01231                     netw_close( &netw );
01232                     return NULL;
01233                 }
01234             }
01235             else
01236             {
01237                 netw_close( &netw );
01238                 return NULL;
01239             }
01240         }
01241         else if( non_blocking == -1 )
01242         {
01243 #if defined(LINUX) || defined(SOLARIS)
01244             int flags = fcntl( from -> link . sock , F_GETFL , 0 );
01245             if( !(flags&O_NONBLOCK) )
01246                 fcntl( from -> link . sock , F_SETFL , flags|O_NONBLOCK );
01247 #else
01248             unsigned long int iMode = 0 ; /* 0 non blocking , 1 blockinh */
01249             int iResult = ioctlsocket( from -> link . sock , FIONBIO, &iMode );
01250             if( iResult != NO_ERROR )
01251             {
01252                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "ioctlsocket failed with error: %ld", iResult );
01253                 netw_close( &netw );
01254                 return NULL ;
01255             }
01256 #endif
01257             tmp = accept( from -> link . sock, (struct sockaddr *)&netw -> link . raddr  , &sin_size );
01258 
01259             if( retval != NULL )
01260                 (*retval) = errno ;
01261 
01262             if ( tmp < 0 )
01263             {
01264                 netw_close( &netw );
01265                 return NULL;
01266             }
01267             /* make the obtained socket blocking if ever it was not */
01268 #if defined(LINUX) || defined(SOLARIS)
01269             flags = fcntl( tmp , F_GETFL , 0 );
01270             flags = flags&(~O_NONBLOCK) ;
01271             fcntl( tmp , F_SETFL , flags );
01272 #else
01273             iResult = ioctlsocket( tmp , FIONBIO, &iMode );
01274             if( iResult != NO_ERROR )
01275             {
01276                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "ioctlsocket failed with error: %ld", iResult);
01277                 netw_close( &netw );
01278                 return NULL ;
01279             }
01280 #endif          
01281         }
01282         else
01283         {
01284             tmp = accept( from -> link . sock, (struct sockaddr *)&netw -> link . raddr , &sin_size );
01285             int error = errno ;
01286             if ( tmp < 0 )
01287             {
01288                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "error accepting on %d, %s" , netw -> link . sock , error );
01289                 netw_close( &netw );
01290                 return NULL;
01291             }
01292         }
01293 
01294         netw -> link . sock = tmp ;
01295         netw -> link . port = strdup( from -> link . port );
01296         Malloc( netw -> link . ip , char , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN + 1 );
01297         if( !inet_ntop( netw -> link . raddr .ss_family , get_in_addr( (struct sockaddr*)&netw -> link . raddr) , netw -> link . ip , INET6_ADDRSTRLEN ) )
01298         {
01299             n_log( LOG_ERR , "inet_ntop: %p , %s" , netw -> link . raddr , strerror( errno ) );  
01300         }
01301 
01302         if( netw_setsockopt( netw -> link . sock , disable_naggle , sock_send_buf , sock_recv_buf ) != TRUE )
01303         {
01304             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Some socket options could not be set on %d" , netw-> link . sock );   
01305         }
01306 
01307         netw_set( netw , NETW_SERVER|NETW_RUN|NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED );
01308 
01309         n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Connection accepted from %s:%s" , netw-> link . ip , netw -> link . port );
01310 
01311         return netw;
01312     } /* netw_accept_from_ex(...) */
01313 
01314 
01315 
01316     /*!\fn NETWORK *netw_accept_from( NETWORK *from )
01317      *\brief make a normal blocking 'accept' . Network 'from' must be allocated with netw_make_listening.
01318      *\param from The network from which to obtaion the connection
01319      *\return NULL 
01320      */
01321     NETWORK *netw_accept_from( NETWORK *from )
01322     {
01323         return netw_accept_from_ex( from , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 );
01324     } /* network_accept_from( ... ) */
01325

01328     /*!\fn NETWORK *netw_accept_nonblock_from( NETWORK *from , int blocking )
01329      *\brief make a normal blocking 'accept' . Network 'from' must be allocated with netw_make_listening.
01330      *\param from The network from which to obtaion the connection
01331      *\param blocking set to -1 to make it non blocking, to 0 for blocking, else it's the select timeout value in mseconds.
01332      *\return NULL 
01333      */
01334     NETWORK *netw_accept_nonblock_from( NETWORK *from , int blocking )
01335     {
01336         return netw_accept_from_ex( from , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , blocking , 0 );
01337     } /* network_accept_from( ... ) */

01340     /*!\fn int netw_add_msg( NETWORK *netw , N_STR *msg )
01341      *\brief Add a message to send in aimed NETWORK
01342      *\param netw NETWORK where add the message
01343      *\param msg  the message to add
01344      *\return TRUE if success FALSE on error
01345      */
01346     int netw_add_msg( NETWORK *netw , N_STR *msg )
01347     {
01348         __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
01349         __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
01350         __n_assert( msg -> data , return FALSE );
01351 
01352         if( msg -> length <= 0 )
01353         {
01354             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Empty messages are not supported. msg(%p)->lenght=%d" , msg , msg -> length );
01355             return FALSE;
01356         }
01357 
01358         pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> sendbolt );
01359 
01360         if( list_push( netw -> send_buf , msg , free_nstr_ptr ) == FALSE )
01361         {
01362             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> sendbolt );
01363             return FALSE;
01364         }
01365 
01366         pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> sendbolt );
01367 
01368         return TRUE;
01369     } /* netw_add_msg(...) */
01370 
01371 
01372 
01373     /*!\fn N_STR *netw_get_msg( NETWORK *netw )
01374      *\brief Get a message from aimed NETWORK
01375      *\param netw NETWORK where get the msg
01376      *\return NULL or a filled N_STR
01377      */
01378     N_STR *netw_get_msg( NETWORK *netw )
01379     {
01380         N_STR * ptr = NULL ;
01381 
01382         __n_assert( netw , return NULL );
01383 
01384         pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> recvbolt );
01385 
01386         ptr = list_shift( netw -> recv_buf , N_STR );
01387 
01388         pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> recvbolt );
01389 
01390         return ptr ;
01391     } /* netw_get_msg(...)*/
01392 
01393 
01394 
01395     /*!\fn N_STR *netw_wait_msg( NETWORK *netw , long refresh , long timeout )
01396      *\brief Wait a message from aimed NETWORK. Recheck each usec until a valid
01397      *\param netw The link on which we wait a message
01398      *\param refresh The time in usec between each check until there is a message
01399      *\param timeout in usecs , maximum amount of time to wait before return. Pass a value <= 0 to disable.
01400      *\return NULL or a filled N_STR 
01401      */
01402     N_STR *netw_wait_msg( NETWORK *netw , long refresh , long timeout )
01403     {
01404         N_STR *nstrptr = NULL ;
01405         int timed = 0 ;
01406 
01407         __n_assert( netw , return NULL );
01408 
01409         if( refresh > 999999 )
01410             refresh = 999999 ;
01411 
01412         if( timeout > 0 )
01413             timed = 1 ;
01414 
01415         int state = NETW_RUN , thr_state = 0 ;
01416 
01417         /* first try without sleep in case there alreay is a message in queue */
01418         nstrptr = netw_get_msg( netw );
01419         if( nstrptr )
01420             return nstrptr ;
01421         do
01422         {
01423             u_sleep( refresh );
01424 
01425             nstrptr = netw_get_msg( netw );
01426             if( nstrptr )
01427                 return nstrptr ;
01428 
01429             if( timed == 1 )
01430             {
01431                 timeout -= refresh ;
01432                 if( timeout < 0 )
01433                 {
01434                     n_log( LOG_ERR , "timed out for netw %d" , netw -> link . sock );
01435                     break ;
01436                 }
01437             }
01438             netw_get_state( netw, &state , &thr_state );
01439 
01440         }while( state == NETW_RUN );
01441 
01442         return NULL ;
01443     } /* netw_wait_msg(...) */
01444 
01445 
01446 
01447     /*!\fn netw_start_thr_engine( NETWORK *netw )
01448      *\brief Start the NETWORK netw Threaded Engine. Create a sending & receiving thread.
01449      *\param netw The aimed NETWORK connection to start receiving data
01450      *\return TRUE on success FALSE on failure
01451      */
01452     int netw_start_thr_engine( NETWORK *netw )
01453     {
01454         __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
01455 
01456         pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> eventbolt );
01457         if( netw -> threaded_engine_status == NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED )
01458         {
01459             n_log( LOG_ERR , "THR Engine already started for network %p" , netw );
01460             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> eventbolt );
01461             return FALSE ;
01462         }
01463 
01464         if( pthread_create(  &netw -> recv_thr ,   NULL ,  netw_recv_func ,  (void *) netw ) != 0 )
01465         {
01466             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to create recv_thread for network %p" , netw );
01467             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> eventbolt );
01468             return FALSE ;
01469         }
01470         if( pthread_create(  &netw -> send_thr ,   NULL ,  netw_send_func ,  (void *) netw ) != 0 )
01471         {
01472             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to create send_thread for network %p" , netw );
01473             pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> eventbolt );
01474             return FALSE ;
01475         }
01476 
01477         netw -> threaded_engine_status = NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED ;
01478 
01479         pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> eventbolt );
01480 
01481         return TRUE ;
01482     }  /* netw_create_recv_thread(....) */
01483 
01484 
01485 
01486     /*!\fn void *netw_send_func( void *NET )
01487      *\brief Thread send function
01488      *\param NET the NETWORK connection to use, casted into (void*)
01489      */
01490     void *netw_send_func( void *NET )
01491     {
01492         int DONE = 0 ,
01493             state = 0 ,
01494             net_status = 0 ;
01495 
01496         NSTRBYTE nboctet = 0 ;
01497 
01498         char nboct[ 4 ];
01499 
01500         N_STR *ptr = NULL ;
01501 
01502         NETWORK *netw = (NETWORK *) NET ;
01503 
01504         __n_assert( netw , return NULL );
01505 
01506         do
01507         {
01508             netw_get_state( netw , &state , NULL );
01509                                                 if( state&NETW_EXITED )
01510                                                 {
01511                                                                 DONE = 100 ;
01512                                                 }
01513                                                 else if( state&NETW_EXIT_ASKED )
01514             {
01515                 DONE = 100 ;
01516                 /* sending state */
01517                 nboctet = htonl( NETW_EXIT_ASKED );
01518                 memcpy( nboct , &nboctet , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01519                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "%d Sending Quit !" , netw -> link . sock );
01520                 net_status = send_data( netw -> link . sock , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01521                 if( net_status < 0 )
01522                     DONE = 4 ;
01523                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "%d Quit sent!" , netw -> link . sock );
01524             }
01525             else
01526             {
01527                 if( !(state&NETW_PAUSE) )
01528                 {
01529                     pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> sendbolt );
01530                     ptr = list_shift( netw -> send_buf , N_STR ) ;
01531                     pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> sendbolt );
01532                     if( ptr && ptr -> length > 0 && ptr -> data )
01533                     {
01534                         n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Sending ptr size %ld written %ld" , ptr -> length , ptr -> written );
01535 
01536                         /* sending state */
01537                         nboctet = htonl( state );
01538                         memcpy( nboct , &nboctet , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01539                         /* sending state */
01540                         if ( !DONE )
01541                         {
01542                             net_status = send_data( netw -> link . sock , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01543                             if( net_status < 0 )
01544                                 DONE = 1 ;
01545                         }
01546                         if( !DONE )
01547                         {
01548                             /* sending number of octet */
01549                             nboctet = htonl( ptr -> written );
01550                             memcpy( nboct , &nboctet , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01551                             /* sending the number of octet to receive on next message */
01552                             net_status = send_data( netw -> link . sock , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01553                             if( net_status < 0 )
01554                                 DONE = 2 ;
01555                         }
01556                         /* sending the data itself */
01557                         if ( !DONE )
01558                         {
01559                             net_status = send_data( netw -> link . sock , ptr -> data , ptr -> written );
01560                             if( net_status < 0 )
01561                                 DONE = 3 ;
01562                         }
01563                         free_nstr( &ptr );
01564 
01565                         u_sleep(  netw -> send_queue_consecutive_wait ); /* we will have to make a sleep thing for that */
01566                     }
01567                     else
01568                     {
01569                         u_sleep( netw -> send_queue_wait );
01570                     }
01571                 }
01572                 else /* Network PAUSED */
01573                 {
01574                     u_sleep( netw -> pause_wait );
01575                 }
01576             }
01577         }while( !DONE );
01578 
01579         if( DONE == 1 )
01580             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when sending state %d on socket %d, network: %s" , netw -> state , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01581         else if( DONE == 2 )
01582             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when sending number of octet to socket %d, network: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01583         else if( DONE == 3 )
01584             n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "Error when sending data on socket %d, network: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01585         else if( DONE == 4 )
01586             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when sending state QUIT on socket %d, network: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01587         else if( DONE == 5 )
01588             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when sending state QUIT number of octet (0) on socket %d, network: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01589 
01590         if( DONE == 100 )
01591         {
01592             n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Socket %d: Sending thread exited !" , netw -> link . sock );
01593             netw_set( netw , NETW_EXIT_ASKED );
01594         }
01595         else
01596         {
01597             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Closing send thread for socket %d\nReason unknown\nDONE = %d" , netw -> link . sock , DONE );
01598             netw_set( netw , NETW_ERROR );
01599         }   
01600 
01601         pthread_exit( 0 );
01602 
01603         /* suppress compiler warning */
01604 #if !defined( LINUX ) && !defined( SOLARIS )
01605         return NULL ;
01606 #endif
01607     } /* netw_send_func(...) */
01608 
01609 
01610 
01611     /*!\fn void *netw_recv_func( void *NET )
01612      *\brief To Thread Receiving function
01613      *\param NET the NETWORK connection to use
01614      */
01615     void *netw_recv_func( void *NET )
01616     {
01617         int DONE = 0 ,
01618             state = 0 ,
01619             tmpstate = 0 ,
01620             net_status = 0 ;
01621 
01622         NSTRBYTE nboctet = 0 ;
01623 
01624         char nboct[ 4 ];
01625 
01626         N_STR *recvdmsg = NULL ;
01627 
01628         NETWORK *netw = (NETWORK *) NET ;
01629 
01630         __n_assert( netw , return NULL );
01631 
01632         do
01633         {
01634             netw_get_state( netw , &state , NULL );
01635 
01636             if( state&NETW_EXIT_ASKED || state&NETW_EXITED )
01637             {
01638                 DONE = 100;
01639             }
01640             else
01641             {
01642                 /*if( !DONE && !(state&NETW_EXIT_ASKED) && !(state&NETW_EXITED) ) */
01643                 if( !DONE ) 
01644                 {   
01645                     if( !(state&NETW_PAUSE) )
01646                     {
01647                         /* receiving state */
01648                         net_status = recv_data( netw -> link . sock , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01649                         if( net_status < 0 )
01650                         {
01651                             DONE = 1 ;
01652                         }
01653                         else
01654                         {
01655                             memcpy( &nboctet , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01656                             tmpstate = ntohl( nboctet );
01657                             nboctet = tmpstate ;
01658                             if( tmpstate==NETW_EXIT_ASKED )
01659                             {
01660                                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "%d receiving order to QUIT, nboctet %d NETW_EXIT_ASKED %d !" , netw -> link . sock , nboctet , NETW_EXIT_ASKED );
01661 
01662                                 DONE = 100 ;
01663                                 netw_set( netw , NETW_EXIT_ASKED );
01664                             }
01665                             else
01666                             {
01667                                 /* receiving nboctet */
01668                                 net_status = recv_data( netw -> link . sock , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01669                                 if( net_status < 0 )
01670                                 {
01671                                     DONE = 2 ;
01672                                 }
01673                                 else
01674                                 {
01675                                     memcpy( &nboctet , nboct , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
01676                                     tmpstate = ntohl( nboctet );
01677                                     nboctet = tmpstate ;
01678 
01679                                     Malloc( recvdmsg , N_STR , 1 );
01680                                     n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "%d octets to receive..." , nboctet );
01681                                     Malloc( recvdmsg -> data , char , nboctet + 1 );
01682                                     recvdmsg -> length  = nboctet + 1 ;
01683                                     recvdmsg -> written = nboctet ;
01684 
01685                                     /* receiving the data itself */
01686                                     net_status = recv_data( netw -> link . sock , recvdmsg -> data , nboctet );
01687                                     if( net_status < 0 )
01688                                     {
01689                                         DONE = 3 ;
01690                                     }
01691                                     else
01692                                     {
01693                                         pthread_mutex_lock( &netw -> recvbolt );
01694                                         if( !DONE && list_push( netw -> recv_buf , recvdmsg , free_nstr_ptr ) == FALSE )
01695                                             DONE = 4 ;
01696                                         pthread_mutex_unlock( &netw -> recvbolt );
01697                                     } /* recv data */
01698                                 } /* recv nb octet*/
01699                             } /* exit asked */
01700                         } /* recv state */
01701                     }
01702                     else
01703                     {
01704                         u_sleep( netw -> pause_wait );
01705                     }
01706                 } /* if( !done) */
01707             } /* if !exit */
01708 
01709         }while( !DONE );
01710 
01711         if( DONE == 1 )
01712             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when receiving state from socket %d, net_status: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01713         else if( DONE == 2 )
01714             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when receiving nboctet from socket %d, net_status: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01715         else if( DONE == 3 )
01716             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error when receiving data from socket %d, net_status: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01717         else if( DONE == 4 )
01718             n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Error adding receved message from socket %d, net_status: %s" , netw -> link . sock , (net_status==-2)?"disconnected":"socket error" );
01719 
01720 
01721         if( DONE == 100 )
01722         {
01723             n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Socket %d: Receive thread exiting !" , netw -> link . sock );
01724             netw_set( netw , NETW_EXIT_ASKED );
01725         }
01726         else
01727         {
01728             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Closing recv thread for socket %d\nReason unknown\nDONE = %d" , netw -> link . sock , DONE );
01729             netw_set( netw , NETW_ERROR );
01730         }
01731 
01732         pthread_exit( 0 );
01733 
01734         /* suppress compiler warning */
01735 #if !defined( LINUX ) && !defined( SOLARIS )
01736         return NULL ;
01737 #endif
01738     } /* netw_recv_func(...) */
01739

01742     /*!\fn netw_stop_thr_engine( NETWORK *netw )
01743      *\brief Stop a NETWORK connection sending and receing thread
01744      *\param netw The aimed NETWORK conection to stop
01745      *\return TRUE on success FALSE on failure
01746      */
01747     int netw_stop_thr_engine( NETWORK *netw )
01748     {
01749         __n_assert( netw ,  return FALSE );
01750         int state = 0 , thr_engine_status = 0 ;
01751 
01752         n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "Network %d stop threads event" , netw -> link . sock );
01753 
01754         netw_get_state( netw , &state , &thr_engine_status );
01755 
01756         if( thr_engine_status != NETW_THR_ENGINE_STARTED )
01757         {
01758             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Thread engine status already stopped for network %p" , netw );
01759             return FALSE ;
01760         }
01761 
01762         netw_set( netw , NETW_EXIT_ASKED );
01763 
01764         n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "Network %d waits for send threads to stop" , netw -> link . sock );
01765         pthread_join( netw -> send_thr , NULL );
01766         n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "Network %d waits for recv threads to stop" , netw -> link . sock );
01767         pthread_join( netw -> recv_thr , NULL );
01768 
01769         netw_set( netw , NETW_EXITED|NETW_THR_ENGINE_STOPPED );
01770 
01771         n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "Network %d threads Stopped !" , netw -> link . sock );
01772 
01773         return TRUE;
01774     } /* Stop_Network( ... ) */

01778     /*!\fn send_data( SOCKET s , char *buf, NSTRBYTE n )
01779      *\brief send data onto the socket
01780      *\param s connected socket
01781      *\param buf pointer to buffer
01782      *\param n number of characters we want to send
01783      *\return -1 on error, -2 on disconnection, n on success
01784      */
01785     int send_data( SOCKET s, char *buf, NSTRBYTE n )
01786     {
01787         int bcount = 0 ; /* counts bytes read */
01788         int br = 0 ;     /* bytes read this pass */
01789 
01790         __n_assert( buf , return -1 );
01791 
01792         if( n == 0 )
01793         {
01794             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Send of 0 is unsupported." );
01795             return -1 ;
01796         }
01797 
01798         while( (NSTRBYTE)bcount < n )                 /* loop until full buffer */
01799         {
01800             if ( ( br = send( s, buf, n - bcount, NETFLAGS ) ) > 0 )
01801             {
01802                 bcount += br;                /* increment byte counter */
01803                 buf += br;                   /* move buffer ptr for next read */
01804             }
01805             else
01806             {
01807                 if( errno == ECONNRESET )
01808                 {
01809                     n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "socket %d disconnected !" , s );
01810                     return -2 ;
01811                 }
01812                 /* signal an error to the caller */
01813                 n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "Socket %d receive Error: %d , %s" , s , br , strerror( errno ) );
01814                 return -1 ;
01815             }
01816         }
01817 
01818         return bcount;
01819     } /*send_data(...)*/
01820 
01821 
01822 
01823     /*!\fn recv_data( SOCKET s , char *buf, NSTRBYTE n )
01824      *\brief recv data from the socket
01825      *\param s connected socket
01826      *\param buf pointer to buffer
01827      *\param n number of characters we want
01828      *\return -1 on error, -2 on disconnection n on success
01829      */
01830     int recv_data( SOCKET s, char *buf , NSTRBYTE n )
01831     {
01832         int bcount = 0 ; /* counts bytes read */
01833         int br = 0 ;     /* bytes read this pass */
01834 
01835         __n_assert( buf , return -1 );
01836 
01837         if( n == 0 )
01838         {
01839             n_log( LOG_ERR , "Recv of 0 is unsupported." );
01840             return -1 ;
01841         }
01842 
01843         while( (NSTRBYTE)bcount < n )
01844         {                                        /* loop until full buffer */
01845 
01846             if ( ( br = recv( s, buf, n - bcount, NETFLAGS ) ) > 0 )
01847             {
01848                 bcount += br;                    /* increment byte counter */
01849                 buf += br;                       /* move buffer ptr for next read */
01850             }
01851             else
01852             {
01853                 if( br == 0 )
01854                 {
01855                     n_log( LOG_DEBUG ,  "socket %d disconnected !" , s );
01856                     return -2 ;
01857                 }
01858                 /* signal an error to the caller */
01859                 n_log( LOG_ERR ,  "socket %d receive Error: %s" , s , strerror( errno ) );
01860                 return -1 ;
01861             }
01862         }
01863 
01864         return bcount;
01865     } /*recv_data(...)*/
